div.class: col-xs-12 col-sm-8 col-md-6 col-lg-6 backgroundcolor center3column

span.p: Dear Parents & Guardians:
We wish to thank you again for your continued efforts during this crisis. I am very proud of how everyone has worked together to navigate this difficult time in our history.

Governor Cuomo has announced the extension of New York State on PAUSE through May 15, 2020, which will keep all schools in New York State closed. We will continue to instruct, support, and provide meals through this time.

Also listed under this directive, all non-essential workers are to work from home and are required to maintain a 6-foot distance from others in public. Governor Cuomo has also issued an Executive Order requiring all people in New York State to wear masks or face coverings in public beginning on Friday, April 17, 2020.
Additionally, the June 6th SAT has been cancelled by the College Board in alignment with public health guidelines.
span.div: I know this is a hardship for all involved -- we miss our students and colleagues and they miss us. However, the decision to return to school will be made by the governor’s office. We must follow federal, state and county health guidelines in order to defeat this virus. The health and wellness of our students and staff will always be a top priority.

span.p: The Regular Board of Education Meeting on April 23, 2020 at 6:00 p.m. will be held electronically:
The web address to stream this meeting is:
The password is: welcome
The teleconference number, to listen to this meeting is:
Access code: 719 555 524
April 7, 2020
Dear Parents and Guardians:
This letter is to confirm all schools will be closed until April 29th by order of Governor Cuomo. We will continue to provide instruction and meals through this new date.

In other news, the New York State Education Department cancelled Regents exams for June 2020. The good news is The New York State Education Department issued further guidance that basically allows students who will pass the course will receive credit for that course’s Regents exam. This is a great decision and it will end a lot of anxiety for our students.

span.p: Please see the attached document for information on child care services for essential workers:

p.a: Essential Workers Child Care Informational Flyer

div.a: Coursework Drop Off Information for April 2nd & 3rd

span.p: Hello, Ticonderoga School District Parents and Students:

A good number of students and parents have been submitting completed work to their teachers digitally via the internet. For those of you who are unable to use such an option, we have set up drop off bins at the ES-MS. Drop off will be Thursday and Friday between the hours of 8:00 AM and 3:00 PM. The lobby closed to the Elementary will have bins for grades PK-5. The lobby closest to the Middle School will have bins for grades 6-12. In addition, we have paper packets for the next round of schoolwork for students who have been identified as not having access to the internet. We received names of students from your teachers and have prepared packets for identified students. When you drop off work, we will provide you a packet. If for some reason we do not have a packet prepared for you and you do not receive work via the internet, we will add you to our print list and prepare a packet for you. Packets not picked up or not ready on Thursday and Friday, will be delivered on either Tuesday or Wednesday of next week. Please when coming to the building, be patient and practice physical distancing as we get people into and out of the lobbies. We look forward to the near future when we can have school as usual. Stay safe and stay healthy.

On Friday, March 27, 2020, Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that all public schools in New York State will remain closed until April 15 due to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic (Executive Order 202.11). This new Executive Order supersedes all previous notifications about potential dates to return to school, including those issued by CVES and its 16 component school districts. Gov. Cuomo has full authority to make this decision, and local schools support his direction during this pandemic. All area schools will return only upon the Governor’s orders.

a.title: Click to read more about: COVID-19 Closure Update 3/31/2020

div.a: Read More about COVID-19 Closure Update 3/31/2020

span.p: If you are 21 or older and have not earned your high school diploma, now may be the time for you. CV-TEC offers free distance learning program either by mail or through your email. If you are interested please call Alexis at (518) 288-8089 or email her at Dirolf_alexis@cves.org. We are here to help!

The district will be changing their food delivery schedule for families who have opted-in to this service as of Monday, March 30th. Deliveries will now be on Monday, Tuesday and Thursday. Monday's delivery will be one meal, while Tuesday and Thursday will be two meals.

div.a: NYS Office of Mental Health flyer on Managing Anxiety

span.p: Please see the attached link for a flyer from the New York State Office of Mental Health titled "Managing Anxiety in an Anxiety-Provoking Situation", a guide for managing stress and anxiety during the COVID-19 outbreak:

p.a: OHM Guidance for Managing Stress and Anxiety During the COVID-19 Outbreak

p.b: Dear Parents, Guardians and Community Members:

The last few days have been challenging, but rewarding as an educational leader to see our staff work tirelessly together during this abrupt time in our lives. I am extremely proud of the work our staff has completed this week.

a.title: Click to read more about: COVID-19 - School Closure Update #2

div.a: Read More about COVID-19 - School Closure Update #2

p.b: Ticonderoga Central School District will be preparing breakfast and lunch for children whose families opt-in for this service during school closure. If you would like meals delivered for your child(ren) during the school closure, it is IMPERATIVE that you email the school at food@ticonderogak12.org to be included. The district will need the names of all children in the household ages 1-18 and the physical location for the meal to be dropped off at. Only if you do not have access to email, please call (518)585-7400, ext.1134. There will be no charge for these meals.

Meals will be delivered to your home. To maintain social distancing, the package will be delivered with a knock on your door. The individual delivering will not wait for you to answer the door. Please understand that this procedure is being put in place to protect all involved. We expect these packages to be delivered between 10:30 a.m and 1:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, but please allow flexibility with times as we begin this process.
Thank you for your ongoing support.

span.p: Please find a Community Resources document for the Adirondack Region regarding the COVID-19 impact from the United Way of the Adirondack Region:

p.b: Dear Parents, Guardians and Community Members,

We are currently living in a very difficult time in our history. As you are well aware, we have been following the guidance of the Essex County Public Health Department, NYS Department of Health and the New York State Education Department. This guidance helped us to develop strategies of preparation in case of the spread of COVID-19, the coronavirus. All of our decisions are to best protect our students, staff and community.
This weekend the decision was made to close schools in our CVES BOCES region until at least 4/19/20.

span.p: Please see the attached link for a letter from Essex County Health Department Public Health Unit regarding COVID-19 school containment and mitigations efforts dated March 15, 2020:

p.a: Letter from Essex County Health Department

span.p: March 15, 2020
Dear Parents, Guardians, and Community Members:

Champlain Valley Educational Services BOCES and its 16 component school districts unanimously decided to close schools immediately until at least April 19, 2020. The districts, in collaboration with the county Health Departments, will remain in regular communication to assess the situation.
